meanings.definition: A complex red pigment containing iron and porphyrin, found in hemoglobin.
meanings.sent1: The hematins in our blood help carry oxygen throughout our bodies.
meanings.sent2: Doctors can study the hematins in the blood to understand a person's health.
meanings.sent3: The scientist accidentally spilled the hematins on his lab coat, turning it a deep red color.
meanings.sent4: The hematins danced under the microscope, revealing their intricate structure.
meanings.sent5: The artist used vibrant hematins to paint a beautiful picture of the human circulatory system.

meanings.definition: A derivative of hematin, used in the treatment of porphyria.
meanings.sent1: The medication contains hematins that help manage the symptoms of porphyria.
meanings.sent2: Patients with porphyria rely on hematins to improve their quality of life.
meanings.sent3: The doctor prescribed a dose of hematins to alleviate the effects of porphyria.
meanings.sent4: The hematins acted like warriors, fighting against the porphyria attacking the body.
meanings.sent5: The hematins brought relief to the patient, easing the discomfort caused by porphyria.
